text:
The CCPA’s restrictions
apply wherever federal and state courts have jurisdiction. As used in the CCPA,
the term “state” includes any state, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the District
of Columbia, and any territory or possession of the United States. The CCPA definition
of the term “state” is found at 15 U.S.C. 1602(r).
html: The CCPA’s restrictions apply wherever federal and state courts have jurisdiction. As used in the CCPA, the term “state” includes any state, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the District of Columbia, and any territory or possession of the United States. The CCPA definition of the term “state” is found at 15 U.S.C. 1602(r).
